snippet: The recent Fort Hood shooting has shed light on the difficulties the military has had in identifying soldiers at high risk of violence and deciding whether to restrict their access to firearms.
abstract: Recent Fort Hood shooting, in which Army specialist Ivan Lopez opened fire with a 45-caliber Smith & Wesson handgun, is shedding light on difficulties the military has had in identifying soldiers at high risk of violence and deciding whether to restrict their access to firearms; Lopez turned his firearm first on others before using weapon on himself; it is not clear if any measure put in place to prevent suicide would have deterred him.

byline.original: By ERICA GOODE and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: The recent Fort Hood shooting has shed light on the difficulties the military has had in identifying soldiers at high risk of violence and deciding whether to restrict their access to firearms.
